snippet: Despite hedge funds’ high fees and underwhelming performance this year, most public pension funds have not followed Calpers in its move away from them.
abstract: Gretchen Morgenson Fair Game column points out that year after California Public Employees' Retirement System said it would wind down its $4 billion portfolio of hedge fund holdings, most other pension managers and institutional investors are not doing so; says funds have so-so returns and high fees.
lead_paragraph: Despite hedge funds’ high fees and underwhelming performance this year, most public pension funds have not followed Calpers in its move away from them.

headline.print_headline: A Sales Pitch Casts a Spell on Pensions
headline.main: A Hedge Fund Sales Pitch Casts a Spell on Public Pensions
